name: Kepler-324
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-324 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-324 is a star with 0.7350000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.84 times its radius. It is located 1659.94 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-324 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-324 b

Kepler-324 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.39 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-324.

The mass of Kepler-324 b is 1.33 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-324 b is 1.14 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-324 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-324 c

Kepler-324 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.26 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 51.81 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-324.

The mass of Kepler-324 c is 15.10 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-324 c is 3.15 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-324 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-324, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
